title: Ljubivoje Ršumović
content:
Ljubivoje Ršumović (Serbian Cyrillic: Љубивоје Ршумовић; born 3 July 1939) is a Serbian poet and writer.[1]

Ršumović is predominantly a writer and poet for children; however, a portion of his work is literature for adults.

He was born on 3 July 1939 in the village of Ljubiš in the Zlatibor Mountains.[2] His parents were Mihailo and Milesa Ršumović. He was educated in Ljubiš, Čajetina, Užice, and Belgrade. He has a bachelor's degree from the University of Belgrade's Faculty of Philology.[3][4] He is known as author of lyrics of anthem of Red Star Belgrade.[5]
